Solution

::: {.solution-block-body}

(a)
One key challenge is balancing efficiency with flexibility. Many traditional inventory systems aim to minimise costs by keeping stock levels low (like with just-in-time models), but these systems struggle when there is uncertainty or sudden changes in demand. This makes businesses vulnerable to stockouts or delays when things donâ€™t go as planned.

(b)
David Jones experiences unpredictable demand spikes during the holiday season. If they rely on a rigid or overly efficient inventory rule, they risk running out of popular items like gift hampers or over-ordering and being left with excess stock. To avoid this, they need a more flexible approach that can adjust to regional sales trends, promotion effects, and delivery timing issues.
